Hey Cas, please meet Thomas your incredible E-Mentor I've been telling you about :smile:.  Feel free to introduce yourselves, say a little bit about what you would like to get out of the mentorship and continue chatting within this channel. :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message myself or emma-prospela if you have any questions. All the best for now! :slightly_smiling_face:
_@dexter has left the channel_
_@dexter has left the channel_
Hi Cas! Dexter told me you're into 3D Modelling and Env work, but using Houdini?

Hey there! I’m recent graduate from London South Bank University and always been interested to go into environment art, I have manly been using maya but in the recent weeks I have been switching to Houndini due to some environment artists in the industry told me it’s the up coming tool for that field of work

I've not had much experience in Environment work, but Houdini definitely is becoming more versatile and being used a lot more than just FX work. So the Houdini side of things, can try and help with any questions

Thank you! Yes I am still gettin into the basics so I can easily find all my answers on google! But if I have more complicated question I will ask you if that’s okay(:? I was wondering, I filled in Environment TD which I noticed a lot of people say TD doesn’t exists in environment work a lot bc it doesn’t involve a lot of code, I was just wondering what your opinion is on that, I’m fairly confused if I should be learning a lot of code if I wanted to go into this direction or if I should focus more on composition? Thank you so much!
That's okay :slightly_smiling_face:

Code wise, I feel like learning basic python or basic VEX would definitely be helpful. Even if it's only to learn how to create random spreads and generations of elements. I wouldn't stress yourself out to begin with trying to learn to code, but if something comes up that you thought "ah yes, that would benefit from a piece of code" then it would be useful to learn maybe a few lines just to help out.
I know there's tutorials and such out there about creating cities with python, which is at one end of the scale, but the random selection of buildings, or trees and plants based on a library, would benefit from basic code. In my opinion
Yeah, I will get into that! I sort off understand python from Maya, haven’t written my own scripts yet but I will try find some good tutorials online for basic python or VEX in Houndini(:
Python and VEX are sort of similar. If I get chance at work tomorrow, I'll have a look and see if I can spot any good basic VEX tuts

That would be amazing! Thank you so much!(:!
I will sent u my reel and portfolio, it’s still WIP.

I made this reel when I was at NextGen bootcamp: <https://vimeo.com/351582318>

Still a WIP(8 weeks) 

I did a uni degree, but if I gotta be honest our course was really bad and we barely learned anything, should’ve dropped out but remained anyways, so nearly everything I do is self taught, also only realised in the past 2 months what it takes to get into the industry since my university gave us a kind off false perspective haha, so got quite a rookie reel even tho after a degree, but been working non stop past few weeks! So hopefully seeing a lot of improvement over the next couple of months haha(:

attachments.text: This is my Environment demoreel 2019, these works where done in the past 8 weeks and is my recent work I did at the NextGen Futures

text: Honestly, my course was the same at Uni. They tried to teach the basics of everything, and cover a lot of ground, but not a lot was useful in the industry. My first day in Houdini was my first day on a film, so I've learnt on the job and as I've gone along!
The work for 8 weeks is good! Potential to take some of the projects further or use as a basis for other ideas

I am looking to take the snow mountain scene to the next level, I need to work on the ridges and to make it look more realistic, I wanted to re-make the scene in Houndini so that’s why I have been learning it and maybe see if I could add clouds to it for realism, and gotta play around with the composition(: will see what it brings.
Looking at heightfields on Houdini?
I haven’t touched heightfields yet but planning to use it in few days, don’t have access to my pc atm
